verses.kjv: The word of the LORD came again unto me, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came again to me, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to me again:

verses.kjv: Son of man, say unto the prince of Tyrus, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Because thine heart is lifted up, and thou hast said, I am a God, I sit in the seat of God, in the midst of the seas; yet thou art a man, and not God, though thou set thine heart as the heart of God:
verses.web: “Son of man, tell the prince of Tyre, ‘The Lord LORD says: “Because your heart is lifted up, and you have said, ‘I am a god, I sit in the seat of God, in the middle of the seas;’ yet you are man, and not God, though you set your heart as the heart of God—
verses.ct: "Son of man, tell the prince of Tyrus, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: Your heart has grown proud, and you've declared, "I am a god! I sit on God's throne in the heart of the seas." But you are only a man, not God — even though you think of yourself as equal to God.

verses.kjv: Behold, thou art wiser than Daniel; there is no secret that they can hide from thee:
verses.web: behold, you are wiser than Daniel; there is no secret that is hidden from you;
verses.ct: Oh, you think you're wiser than Daniel! No secret is hidden from you!

verses.kjv: With thy wisdom and with thine understanding thou hast gotten thee riches, and hast gotten gold and silver into thy treasures:
verses.web: by your wisdom and by your understanding you have gotten yourself riches, and have gotten gold and silver into your treasures;
verses.ct: Through your wisdom and cleverness you've built up great wealth, filling your treasuries with gold and silver.

verses.kjv: By thy great wisdom and by thy traffick hast thou increased thy riches, and thine heart is lifted up because of thy riches:
verses.web: by your great wisdom and by your trading you have increased your riches, and your heart is lifted up because of your riches—”
verses.ct: Through your brilliant trading strategies you've multiplied your riches, and all that wealth has made your heart swell with pride.'

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Because thou hast set thine heart as the heart of God;
verses.web: “ ‘therefore the Lord LORD says: “Because you have set your heart as the heart of God,
verses.ct: "Therefore, this is what the Lord GOD says: Because you think of yourself as equal to God,

verses.kjv: Behold, therefore I will bring strangers upon thee, the terrible of the nations: and they shall draw their swords against the beauty of thy wisdom, and they shall defile thy brightness.
verses.web: therefore, behold, I will bring strangers on you, the terrible of the nations. They will draw their swords against the beauty of your wisdom. They will defile your brightness.
verses.ct: I am going to bring foreigners against you — the most ruthless nations on earth. They will draw their swords against everything your wisdom has built and drag your splendor through the dirt.

verses.kjv: They shall bring thee down to the pit, and thou shalt die the deaths of them that are slain in the midst of the seas.
verses.web: They will bring you down to the pit. You will die the death of those who are slain in the heart of the seas.
verses.ct: They will throw you down into the pit, and you will die a violent death in the heart of the seas.

verses.kjv: Wilt thou yet say before him that slayeth thee, I am God? but thou shalt be a man, and no God, in the hand of him that slayeth thee.
verses.web: Will you yet say before him who kills you, ‘I am God’? But you are man, and not God, in the hand of him who wounds you.
verses.ct: Will you still say 'I am a god' to the one who is killing you? You'll be nothing but a man — not God — helpless in the hands of your slayer.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt die the deaths of the uncircumcised by the hand of strangers: for I have spoken it, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: You will die the death of the uncircumcised by the hand of strangers; for I have spoken it,” says the Lord LORD.’ ”
verses.ct: You will die the shameful death of the uncircumcised at the hands of foreigners. I have spoken it," declares the Lord GOD."

verses.kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: Moreover LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to me again:

verses.kjv: Son of man, take up a lamentation upon the king of Tyrus, and say unto him, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Thou sealest up the sum, full of wisdom, and perfect in beauty.
verses.web: “Son of man, take up a lamentation over the king of Tyre, and tell him, ‘The Lord LORD says: “You were the seal of full measure, full of wisdom, and perfect in beauty.
verses.ct: "Son of man, sing a funeral song over the king of Tyrus. Tell him, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: You were the model of perfection, full of wisdom and flawless in beauty.

verses.kjv: Thou hast been in Eden the garden of God; every precious stone was thy covering, the sardius, topaz, and the diamond, the beryl, the onyx, and the jasper, the sapphire, the emerald, and the carbuncle, and gold: the workmanship of thy tabrets and of thy pipes was prepared in thee in the day that thou wast created.
verses.web: You were in Eden, the garden of God. Every precious stone adorned you: ruby, topaz, emerald, chrysolite, onyx, jasper, sapphire, turquoise, and beryl. Gold work of tambourines and of pipes was in you. They were prepared in the day that you were created.
verses.ct: You were in Eden, the garden of God. Every precious stone covered you — sardius, topaz, diamond, beryl, onyx, jasper, sapphire, emerald, and carbuncle — all set in gold. The craftsmanship of your tambourines and pipes was built into you on the day you were created.

verses.kjv: Thou art the anointed cherub that covereth; and I have set thee so: thou wast upon the holy mountain of God; thou hast walked up and down in the midst of the stones of fire.
verses.web: You were the anointed cherub who covers. Then I set you up on the holy mountain of God. You have walked up and down in the middle of the stones of fire.
verses.ct: You were the anointed cherub, appointed to guard and cover. I placed you there myself. You walked on the holy mountain of God, moving among the stones of fire.

verses.kjv: Thou wast perfect in thy ways from the day that thou wast created, till iniquity was found in thee.
verses.web: You were perfect in your ways from the day that you were created, until unrighteousness was found in you.
verses.ct: You were blameless in everything you did from the day you were created — until sin was found in you.

verses.kjv: By the multitude of thy merchandise they have filled the midst of thee with violence, and thou hast sinned: therefore I will cast thee as profane out of the mountain of God: and I will destroy thee, O covering cherub, from the midst of the stones of fire.
verses.web: By the abundance of your commerce, your insides were filled with violence, and you have sinned. Therefore I have cast you as profane out of God’s mountain. I have destroyed you, covering cherub, from the middle of the stones of fire.
verses.ct: Your vast trade filled you with violence, and you sinned. So I threw you off the mountain of God as something unholy. I destroyed you, guardian cherub, and banished you from among the stones of fire.

verses.kjv: Thine heart was lifted up because of thy beauty, thou hast corrupted thy wisdom by reason of thy brightness: I will cast thee to the ground, I will lay thee before kings, that they may behold thee.
verses.web: Your heart was lifted up because of your beauty. You have corrupted your wisdom by reason of your splendor. I have cast you to the ground. I have laid you before kings, that they may see you.
verses.ct: Your heart grew proud because of your beauty. You corrupted your wisdom for the sake of your splendor. So I hurled you to the ground and put you on display before kings for all of them to see.

verses.kjv: Thou hast defiled thy sanctuaries by the multitude of thine iniquities, by the iniquity of thy traffick; therefore will I bring forth a fire from the midst of thee, it shall devour thee, and I will bring thee to ashes upon the earth in the sight of all them that behold thee.
verses.web: By the multitude of your iniquities, in the unrighteousness of your commerce, you have profaned your sanctuaries. Therefore I have brought out a fire from the middle of you. It has devoured you. I have turned you to ashes on the earth in the sight of all those who see you.
verses.ct: Through your countless sins and your corrupt trading, you defiled your own sanctuaries. So I brought fire out from within you, and it consumed you. I reduced you to ashes on the ground in front of everyone watching.

verses.kjv: All they that know thee among the people shall be astonished at thee: thou shalt be a terror, and never shalt thou be any more.
verses.web: All those who know you among the peoples will be astonished at you. You have become a terror, and you will exist no more.” ’ ”
verses.ct: Everyone among the nations who knew you will be horrified at what happened to you. You have become a thing of terror, and you will be gone forever.'"

verses.kjv: Again the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, set thy face against Zidon, and prophesy against it,
verses.web: “Son of man, set your face toward Sidon, and prophesy against it,
verses.ct: "Son of man, turn and face Zidon, and prophesy against it.

verses.kjv: And say, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I am against thee, O Zidon; and I will be glorified in the midst of thee: and they shall know that I am the LORD, when I shall have executed judgments in her, and shall be sanctified in her.
verses.web: and say, ‘The Lord LORD says: “Behold, I am against you, Sidon. I will be glorified among you. Then they will know that I am LORD, when I have executed judgments in her, and am sanctified in her.
verses.ct: Say, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: I am against you, Zidon, and I will display my glory in your midst. Then they will know that I am the LORD, when I carry out my judgments against her and reveal my holiness through her.

verses.kjv: For I will send into her pestilence, and blood into her streets; and the wounded shall be judged in the midst of her by the sword upon her on every side; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.web: For I will send pestilence into her, and blood into her streets. The wounded will fall within her, with the sword on her on every side. Then they will know that I am LORD.
verses.ct: I will send plague into her and blood will flow in her streets. The wounded will fall within her walls as swords strike from every side. Then they will know that I am the LORD.'

verses.kjv: And there shall be no more a pricking brier unto the house of Israel, nor any grieving thorn of all that are round about them, that despised them; and they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.
verses.web: “ ‘ “There will be no more a pricking brier to the house of Israel, nor a hurting thorn of any that are around them that scorned them. Then they will know that I am the Lord LORD.”
verses.ct: "No longer will the people of Israel have to deal with the painful briers and sharp thorns of their scornful neighbors. Then they will know that I am the Lord GOD."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; When I shall have gathered the house of Israel from the people among whom they are scattered, and shall be sanctified in them in the sight of the heathen, then shall they dwell in their land that I have given to my servant Jacob.
verses.web: “ ‘The Lord LORD says: “When I have gathered the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and am sanctified in them in the sight of the nations, then they will dwell in their own land which I gave to my servant Jacob.
verses.ct: "This is what the Lord GOD says: When I gather the people of Israel back from the nations where they've been scattered, I will show my holiness through them for all the nations to see. Then they will live in their own land — the land I gave to my servant Jacob.

verses.kjv: And they shall dwell safely therein, and shall build houses, and plant vineyards; yea, they shall dwell with confidence, when I have executed judgments upon all those that despise them round about them; and they shall know that I am the LORD their God.
verses.web: They will dwell in it securely. Yes, they will build houses, plant vineyards, and will dwell securely, when I have executed judgments on all those who scorn them all around. Then they will know that I am LORD their God.” ’ ”
verses.ct: They will live there in safety, building houses and planting vineyards. They will dwell in complete security once I have carried out judgment on all the neighbors who treated them with contempt. Then they will know that I am the LORD their God."
